intro: Homaladenia peduncularis, commonly known as the Cape York starfish, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal sand dunes and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. It produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
